tn.text: The word "I" refers to Zechariah.
This means to look up at something. He says "I lifted my eyes" because that is the part of the body a person sees with. AT: "looked up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The word "behold" here shows that Zechariah was surprised by what he saw.
A cubit is 46 centimeters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
The angel continues to speak with Zechariah.

tn.ref: based on what it says on the one side
tn.text: "based on what the scroll has written on one side"

tn.ref: what it says on the other side
tn.text: "what the scroll has written on the other side"
The phrase "their words" refers to what was said in their oath. AT: "according to what they said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The word "it" refers to the curse.

tn.ref: this is the declaration of Yahweh of hosts
tn.text: This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.
This refers to the man's family and everything they own. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"of the man that swears"
wood used for building
This phrase commands a person to look up by referring to their eyes. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This refers to a heavy cover. Lead is a heavy metal.

tn.ref: there was a woman under it sitting in it
tn.text: A woman could not literally fit inside a basket of this size. In Zechariah's vision though, so did fit in the basket. Often in visions the sizes of things are exaggerated. Both the basket and the woman are symbolic and represent other things.
The woman represents wickedness. AT: "Her name is Wickedness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: and wind was in their wings
tn.text: This phrase describes how the women used their wings to be carried by the wind and fly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: they had wings like a stork's wings
tn.text: The women had wings that looked like stork's wings. A stork is a type of large bird that has a wingspan of 2 to 4 meters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
The basket was lifted up into the sky. It says "between earth and heaven" to draw attention to them and show where the basket was in relationship to them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: Where are they taking the basket?
tn.text: "Where are the women taking the barrel?"

tn.ref: so that when the temple is ready ... on its prepared base
tn.text: "and when the temple is ready, the barrel will be set in the place prepared for it"
